article.title: DESCQA: An Automated Validation Framework for Synthetic Sky Catalogs

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure shows the stellar mass function from two sources, the MBII simulation and Li & White (2009). What adjustment was made to the Li & White (2009) data to ensure consistency with the MBII definition of stellar mass?
choices: No adjustment was made.
The Li & White (2009) data was shifted to higher masses to account for the mass in stellar remnants.
The Li & White (2009) data was shifted to lower masses to account for the overestimation of stellar mass in low-mass galaxies.
The Li & White (2009) data was scaled to match the simulation box size of the MBII simulation.

multiple_choice_question.text: The figure compares stellar mass functions from various synthetic galaxy catalogs to the validation data from Li & White (2009). Which class of synthetic catalog models consistently demonstrates the best agreement with the validation data across the entire mass range considered?
choices: Semi-Analytic Models (SAG, Galacticus)
Abundance Matching Models (CAM_LiWhite, SHAM_LiWhite, CAM_MBII, SHAM_MBII)
Improved Halo Occupation Distribution Model (iHOD)
Hydrodynamical Simulation (MBII)

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure compares the halo mass function (HMF) of different synthetic galaxy catalogs with the analytical fit from Tinker et al. (2008).  Why do discrepancies arise between the catalogs at low halo masses (< 10^11 Mâ˜‰)?
choices: Baryonic effects are not accurately modeled in the catalogs.
Different catalogs include varying abundances of low-mass halos due to differences in their halo occupation function.
The Tinker et al. (2008) fit is not accurate at low halo masses.
The resolution of the simulations is insufficient to resolve low-mass halos.

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure displays the projected two-point correlation function, wp(rp), for different synthetic catalogs compared to observational data from SDSS. Which of the following statements is TRUE regarding the performance of the catalogs in reproducing wp(rp)?
choices: All catalogs fail to reproduce the small-scale clustering observed in the SDSS data.
Most catalogs reproduce the SDSS data well within the estimated error bars.
Only the semi-analytic galaxy catalogs accurately capture the shape of the SDSS wp(rp).
The jackknife sample variance is too small to allow for meaningful comparison between catalogs.

multiple_choice_question.text: This equation defines the chi-squared statistic used to assess the agreement between the stellar mass function of a synthetic catalog and the validation data. What does the term "C" represent in this equation?
choices: The number of galaxies in the catalog.
The covariance matrix calculated from the catalog using the jackknife resampling method.
The stellar mass density in a specific mass bin.
The difference between the catalog stellar mass function and the validation data.
